proxy Package¶

client Module¶

class pythonzombie.proxy.client.ZombieProxyClient(socket)¶

Bases: object

Sends data to a ZombieProxyServer bound to a specific TCP socket. Data is evaulated by the server and results (if any) are returned.

__init__(socket)¶

Establish a new ZombieProxyClient.

Parameters:socket – a unix socket address to connect to.
json(js)¶

A shortcut for passing Javascript instructions and decoding a JSON response from node.js.

Parameters:js – the Javascript string to execute
ping()¶

Send a simple Javascript instruction and wait on a reply.

A live Node.JS TCP server will cause this method to return “pong”.

send(js)¶

Establishes a socket connection to the Zombie.js server and sends Javascript instructions.

Parameters:js – the Javascript string to execute
wait(method, *args)¶

Call a method on the zombie.js Browser instance and wait on a callback.

Parameters:
  • method – the method to call, e.g., html()
  • args – one of more arguments for the method
exception pythonzombie.proxy.client.NodeError¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

An exception indicating node.js’ failure to parse or evaluate Javascript instructions it received.

server Module¶

class pythonzombie.proxy.server.ZombieProxyServer(socket=None, wait=True)¶

Bases: object

__init__(socket=None, wait=True)¶

Spawns a node.js subprocess that listens on a TCP socket. A ZombieProxyClient streams data to the server, which evaluates it as Javascript, passes it on to a Zombie.js Browser object, and returns the results.

Parameters:
  • socket – a (random, by default) filepath representing the intended TCP socket location
  • wait – when True, wait until the node.js subprocess is responsive via the specified TCP socket.
